intro: Kengia ramiflora var. tianmushanensis, commonly known as the Tianmushan kengia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, clustered cones. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests. It exhibits a unique growth habit with branching patterns that distinguish it from other members of the genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
